resources.string: What pub are you looking for?

From College Green (Trinity College), turn left and walk down Nassau Street. Take the first right turn and walk all the way up Dawson Street. At the top of Dawson Street, turn left and walk around St. Stephen\'s Green. Then, turn left onto Lesson Street Lower. You will see Alfie Byrne\'s a few feet up this street on the right.
From College Green (Trinity College), turn left and walk over to Grafton Street. Walk up Grafton Street and take the third right turn onto Harry Street. You will see Bruxelles on the right.
From O\' Connell Street, walk over O\' Connell bridge and continue straight onto Westmoreland Street. You will see Cassidys a few feet up this street on the left.
From O\' Connell Street, walk over O\' Connell bridge and continue straight onto D\'Olier Street. Walk up to the top of this street and you will see Doyle\'s on the right.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn left and walk down Nassau Street. Take the first right turn and walk all the way up Dawson Street. Then, turn left and walk around St. Stephen\'s Green. Turn left onto Leeson Street Lower and you will immediately see the East Side Tavern.
From O\'Connell Street, walk past the Savoy Cinema and continue on down to Parnell Street and turn right. Fibber Magees is just a few feet away.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn left and walk down Nassau Street. Take the first right turn and walk all the way up Dawson Street. Then, turn left and walk around St. Stephen\'s Green. Turn left onto Leeson Street Lower and you will see Hartigan\'s a few feet up the street.

From College Green (Trinity College), walk straight up Dame Street. Take the third left turn and walk up South Great George\'s Street. Continue on up this street, past Exchequer Street, and you\'ll soon see Hogan\'s on the left.

From College Green (Trinity College), walk straight up Dame Street. Take the third left turn and walk up South Great George\'s Street. Continue on up this street and onto Aungier Street. J.J. Smyth\'s is on the first left corner of this street.
From College Green (Trinity College), turn left and walk up Grafton Street. Take the third right turn onto South Anne Street. You will see John Kehoe\'s on the left corner.
From O\'Connell Street, walk over O\'Connell bridge and turn left onto Burgh Quay. J.W. Sweetman is just a few steps away.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn left and walk down Nassau Street. Take the first right turn and walk all the way up Dawson Street. Then, turn left at St. Stephen\'s Green and continue on to Merrion Row. You will then see O\' Donoghue\'s on the right.
From College Green (Trinity College), walk straight up Dame Street. Take the third left turn and walk up South Great George\'s Street. The Long Hall is just beyond Fade Street.

From O\'Connell Street, walk over O\'Connell bridge and continue straight onto D\'Olier Street. At the end of this street, take a right up to College Green. From there, walk up Dame Street and turn left onto Trinity Street. Turn right onto Dame Lane and you\'ll see The Stag\'s Head up on the left.

From O\'Connell Street, walk over O\'Connell bridge and turn right onto Aston Quay. Walk straight until you come to the Ha\'penny bridge. Then, turn left and walk under Merchant Arch. You are now in Temple Bar, the Temple Bar is down the cobblestones on the right.

From O\'Connell Street, walk over O\'Connell bridge and continue straight onto D\'Olier Street. At the end of this street, take a right up to College Green. From there, walk up Dame Street and turn left onto South Great Georges Street. Walk up this street a bit and you\'ll see The Globe Bar on your left.
